contentrichtext.text: {{Expand German|topic=geo|date=February 2009|Bad Schussenried}} {{Infobox German Location |Art = Stadt |Wappen = Bad Schussenried Wappen.png |image_photo = Aerials BW 16.06.2006 12-39-06.jpg |lat_deg = 48 |lat_min = 0 |lat_sec = 24 |lon_deg = 9 |lon_min = 39 |lon_sec = 31 |Lageplan = Bad Schussenried in BC.svg |Bundesland = Baden-Württemberg |Regierungsbezirk = Tübingen |Landkreis = Biberach |Höhe = 570 |Fläche = 55.02 |Einwohner = 8458 |Stand = 2005-12-31 |PLZ = 88427 |PLZ-alt = 7953 |Vorwahl = 07583 |Kfz = BC |Gemeindeschlüssel = 08 4 26 014 |Straße = Wilhelm-Schussen-Str. 36 |Website = [http://www.bad-schussenried.de/ www.bad-schussenried.de] |Bürgermeister = Achim Deinet }} [[File:Bad Schussenried Kloster Schussenried 105.JPG|thumb|Fresco by [[Johannes Zick]] in the Church of St. Magnus.]] '''Bad Schussenried''' is a town in [[Upper Swabia]] in the district of [[Biberach (district)|Biberach]], [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]]. It lies on the [[Upper Swabian Baroque Route]]. [[Schussenried Abbey]], a former monastery founded in 1183, is located in Bad Schussenried. Its church and baroque library feature impressive architecture and artwork, including intricate ceiling frescoes. The town is also home to a beer stein museum, the Schussenrieder Bierkrug Museum. [http://www.steincollectors.org/library/articles/museums/Schussen] Bad Schussenried has about 10,000 inhabitants. [[Oswald Metzger]], a former Green party, now Christian democratic politician and cyclist [[Rolf Gölz]], who won a silver medal in the [[1984 Summer Olympics]], are from Bad Schussenried. The world champion women trick cyclists are also from Bad Schussenried. ==World heritage site== It is home to one or more prehistoric [[Stilt house|pile-dwelling]] (or stilt house) settlements that are part of the [[Prehistoric Pile dwellings around the Alps]] [[UNESCO]] [[UNESCO World Heritage Site|World Heritage Site]].<ref name=UNESCO>[http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1363/ UNESCO World Heritage Site - Prehistoric Pile dwellings around the Alps]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.bad-schussenried.de Bad Schussenried] (in German) *[http://www.zfp-web.de Zentren für Psychiatrie (Centers for psychiatry)] (in German) {{Commons category|Bad Schussenried}} {{Cities and towns in Biberach (district)}} [[Category:Biberach (district)]] {{Biberach-geo-stub}}
